data.sampled:
Increase.

To maximize returns, you should increase your exposure to the option contracts that have lower implied volatility and higher probability of success. Since the $40 strike price put has a lower implied volatility compared to the $42 put, it is more likely to increase in value as the stock price declines. Additionally, the $51 strike price call has a higher probability of increasing in value compared to the $53 call since it has a higher strike price. Therefore, you should increase your position in these options contracts to maximize returns.
